WRITING.TEXT: Don't know how real the actual "ghost", is but my fathers construction company is currently doing work on this house in Cranston, Rhode Island and the electrician immediately was taken back at what he saw after he took the picture.

WRITING.TITLE: Electrician took this while working on the job site. We're all freaked out

WRITING.TEXT: Just learned more in under 2 hours than 3 years of film school. Every aspiring filmmaker and screenwriter should watch this.
Oh my god!!!!!!
It's on iTunes
Does anyone know if this is being released anywhere other than the US? Curious to see how foreign box office will affect it.
Hi Chris can't wait to see Drifter! I'm currently enrolled in film school and was wondering if you went to film school, or if you just started with you're film career right away? Thank you!
Does anyone know where to watch this in the US
I can't believe no one has mentioned that it's the same director as "TimeCrimes" such an underrated film that looks to be the same tone as this. Very excited!
Really great film, if you enjoyed that you would also like "The Land".

I firmly believe it can stand on it own against films like, Saving Private Ryan, Enemy at the Gates, Full Metal Jacket, We Were Soldiers, Inglourious Basterds, Platoon, and Black Hawk Down. Not saying it's better than any of those necessarily, however it's just below these choices; clearly making my top 10 favorite war films.
Agreed. I had very little interest when the trailer dropped, the "Help me get one more" line is nowhere near as cheesy as it is in the trailer.

Lots of severed limbs flying around, blood everywhere, maggots eating corpses along with rats, burning bodies, etc. If you want to compare it to something I would use the opening scene of "Saving Private Ryan" where you see the intestines falling out of the soldier. Very realistic.

Not the religious type and i never felt like it was blatantly hitting you over the head with it. A few visuals that resemble religion and the main character prays but other than that it does not throw it in your face and respects you as a viewer.
Just noticed that about the F-bomb..... The violence was absolutely brutal and awesome.
Its a bit jarring at first but you get used to it easily and his character is very likeable so it helps.

WRITING.TITLE: Just Got Back From "Hacksaw Ridge" Early Screening
WRITING.TEXT: I just recently got back from an early screening of "Hacksaw Ridge" and holy shit this movie is amazing. Its honestly one of the best war films ever made and is also one of the best films of the entire year. It manages to be a love story, courtroom drama, horror film, and a thrilling war movie. Ive never seen war depicted in such a horrific way since the opening of "Saving Private Ryan", and this film may have managed to even outdo that one in the gore department. From the trailers I thought I would dislike Andrew Garfield's performance and accent, but i was proven wrong and i believe he really did a great job, along with Vince Vaughn and Sam Worthington. I highly recommend this film to everyone especially if you're looking for a new classic war movie and aside from some pacing issues towards the end its a near perfect movie. 9.5/10
Great to hear! Will definitely check all of those out. Huge inspiration to film and music lovers keep up the good work!
Love the blue ruin and green room can't wait to see what you guys do next. Have any other filmmakers contacted you asking to use your music in their films?
Hello Steve can't wait for Don't Breathe! How was working with Fede on the set? I heard he's great and very passionate about horror.
It's better than Sicario
Saw it last night. One of my favorite films of the year by far. So much humor sprinkled throughout with Jeff Bridges and Chris Pine at their absolute best. Recommend to everyone.
Yes it is. I work at a theatre and a fellow coworker of mine played the teaser in front of the suicide squad IMAX screening this morning.
Saw it last night. One of the best zombie movies in recent memory.
Best/funniest scene in your opinion?

It's the best PG-13 horror film to come out in some time. Solid 7.5/10. Entertaining all the way through with believable characters and motivations, and the last act is one big 20 minute scare fest. However some of the decisions made we're standard horror cliche mistakes, it's easy to look past them. Would highly recommend, theatre experience was god awful though.
